page.title: 01LANDSCAPE,ANNAN
page.content: Most of our area is farmland,the main crop being grass which is used for grazing cattle.Some of the grass is cut for hay or silage. One third of our land cover is sea-part of the Solway Firth,noted for its salmon and its dangerous fast flowing tides.{ The {A75}trunk road and the main Carlisle to Glasgow railway line pass through our block.The {A75}is very heavily used with many large lorries travelling from the ferry from Stranraer to Northern Ireland.A by-pass is being planned to divert most heavy traffic.The eastern corner of Annan and the village of Dornock are residential areas.Other interesting features include the pipeline from Chapelcross,a BMX cycle track,a sports field,a school and a home for old people.
